[dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> @sg777 I think the idea is to have an option to choose how much you want to buy in on a table for. 
For example, when I approach a poker table, I may have $1000 in my physical wallet, but I only put down $250 on the table to play.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> If I lose that $250, I may consider buying in again with any amount of my $750 left

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <hyperDEX> In poker there is short stack (20BB max buyin) normal (100BB max buyin) deep i think is 500BB

Author: Gateway#3763

Also having the option to buy in from xBB(min buy in) to yBB(max buy in)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> sure, don't know much about poker, small doubt, for example player1 joined the table with say suppose $100 and player2 with $200, and there is a scenario if both go allin, isn't it unfair to the player2 since though the odds of winning is same for each player but the bet amount are not in same proportionate

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> In that case, although player 2 is all in, they're only betting with $100 of that all in. Unless player 3 calls the $200 all in.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> Player 2 is raising the bet for other players, and calling the all in for player 1

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> So if player 2 lost, they wouldnt lose their $100 because of that reason

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> oh..okay assuming there are only 2 players, in that case even if player2 lost also he gets his $100 back since player1 put a maximum of only $100

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> Yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> in the case of multiplayer(more than 2) if a player forced to do allin in the initial round of betting...so he has to wait until all other players done playing further round of betting?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> `Two players all-in for different amounts: In this scenario, you take the amount of the smaller stack from the big stack into the pot, returning the difference to the big-stack player.`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> With 3 players or more players
`Short stack all-in against two players: When a short stack is all-in against two larger stacks, the blinds, short stack, plus the amount of the short stack from each larger stack is placed in the main pot. All players are eligible to win this pot.

The two players on the side are now free to play and bet as usual into a side pot, which only they are eligible to win. (This means there can be two winners in the hand - a side pot and a main pot winner.)`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> `Multiple players all-in: When multiple players are all-in, you must make multiple side pots. Make a main pot as described above. After you've done that, repeat the process with the next-smallest stack.

Continue to do this until all stacks are accounted for. Make sure to keep track of who is eligible for what pots.`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> okay so is it the case that everytime a player undergoes allin, a side pot will be created?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> Not every time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> I mean provided if two or more left on the table

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> If everyone else has enough chips to just call them, and it's the last hand, it won't

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> The only time there will be a side pot, is if there are more bets over the all in amount

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> okay so when some player went allin, if there are any other players (more than 1) left who can raise the stake in that case a side pot will be created, am i right here?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> It will be created yes. But if nobody calls that bet, then the bet goes back to the player who raised it, and the hand continues as an all in

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> and the side pot is only the amount above the all in

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <sg777> okay, so based on this, side pot or main pot always contains the equal contribution from all the players whover in the pot..

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> `The golden, overarching rule to keep in mind is that each player matches each opponents' bet with as much as is left in his stack.
All players still in the pot are obligated to match whatever the smallest stack has contributed to the pot. This is the "main pot.‚Äù
The player with the next smallest stack then is required to match remaining bets from players with bigger stacks, and so on.
This is put into a ‚Äúside pot‚Äù with each respective player.`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> If that clears it up

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> It gets super complicated if everyone has different amounts

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> <https://www.pokerlistings.com/rules-for-poker-all-in-situations-poker-side-pot-calculator>

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <NutellaLicka> Obviously with a simple  pot calculator it is not an issue
